Class WelcomeStage

java.lang.Object
javafx.stage.Window
javafx.stage.Stage
com.example.miniproyecto3.view.WelcomeStage
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.event.EventTarget
public class WelcomeStage extends javafx.stage.Stage
The WelcomeStage class represents the initial stage (window) of the application, displaying the welcome screen for the user to start or continue a game. It uses the Singleton design pattern to ensure that only one instance of the stage exists at any given time. This class is responsible for loading the FXML view, applying stylesheets, initializing the controller, and configuring visual settings such as icons and titles. If any visual resource fails to load, a VisualException is thrown.
Since:
version 1.0
Version:
3.0
Author:
David Taborda Montenegro and Juan Pablo Piedrahita Triana.

  • Constructor Details

    • WelcomeStage

      public WelcomeStage() throws VisualException
      Constructs the welcome stage by loading its FXML layout and configuring the stage.
      Throws:
      VisualException - if the FXML file or resources fail to load properly.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static WelcomeStage getInstance() throws VisualException
      Returns the singleton instance of WelcomeStage. If it doesn't exist, a new instance is created.
      Returns:
      the single instance of WelcomeStage.
      Throws:
      VisualException - if the stage fails to initialize.

    • deleteInstance

      public static void deleteInstance()
      Deletes the current instance of WelcomeStage, closing the window and releasing the reference.

    • getWelController

      public WelcomeController getWelController()
      Returns the controller associated with the welcome stage.
      Returns:
      the WelcomeController for this stage.
